Reviews.Title: “Labor Day weekend!”
Reviews.Author: joannam66michael
Reviews.Content: My Family and I stayed at HomeStay Inn over Labor day weekend. A friend of mine told me about the Hotel. Our room was clean and Comfortable. The pool was clean and the breakfast was really good every morning. The staff was very nice to my family while we was there. The Haygoods Fan Club, Team Haygood, met at the Hotel for a pre-show Party. The Hotel was kind enough to put on their marquee, "WELCOME TEAM HAYGOOD. Paige, Manager of the Hotel, got Pizza Hut to Donate Pizza and Soda for our Party. Thank you to Paige and Staff for making our visit so much fun. and we recommend this Hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful family friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Glasseater
Reviews.Content: This is an older,but very nice and clean hotel. We had 3 rooms Each room was very clean and comfortable The staff was helpful as well as friendly. The pool area was clean. The breakfast was d. There are a lot of hotels in the area to pick from. We will come back to this one !

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Joygail22
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here on Father's Day weekend, I was told about the HomeStay by some friends of mine that always stay here, and I can see why they do! The staff was very nice, the room was nice and clean, the breakfast was good, but my favorite was the pool! I loved the fact that I could go enjoy the pool during the day, go see my show (or go to dinner) and go back to the pool after the show, if I chose to.....which I did! That is a nice change! The HomeStay Inn's name fits this hotel perfectly! I felt at home!! I will definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Erik H
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at HomeStay several times. It is now our 'go-to' Hotel in Branson. Paige, the manager, and her staff are always wonderful. Very polite and friendly, and willing to help make your stay the best it can be. Great breakfast with make your own waffles and other options. Clean rooms and comfortable beds. We love that they accept pets too. Have recommended this Hotel for family & friends many times.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Branson”
Reviews.Author: ladybug7812
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay in Branson at the HomeStay Inn! The rooms were Super CLEAN and cleanliness is huge for my family! Everything in our room worked and the Staff were all friendly and helpful! I highly recommend this hotel! The kids loved the pool, specially since Paige said as long as they were quiet they could swim till 11pm :) since we arrived late on Friday night.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Barbiechiefs21
Reviews.Content: Clean Rooms, Nice Place! Appreciate the hospitality and service from Paige and staff at HomeStay Inn. Very nice place. Rooms were very clean and everything was ready to go. Paige was very helpful with anything and everything we needed! Very pleasant, efficient staff. Didn't feel like we were a bother to anyone with our requests! Convenient location off the strip madness, but close enough that you can use the back roads to bypass the strip and get where you want efficiently. We had a pet room and you couldn't tell that it was a pet room they keep it that clean! Well done Paige! Thanks for the hookup!!! We'll be back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Home Stay feels alot like Home!”
Reviews.Author: KelsHill
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good things about this place. The rooms are very clean and nicely decorated. Having a microwave and fridge is a huge plus (at no extra charge even). But I must say Paige and her staff are so pleasant, efficient, and accomodating that you feel like family. No request was too big or even too small to get the utmost prompt attention from everyone and I was never made to feel like an imposition. Smiles and great attitudes never waivered from any of the staff I came into contact with. Housekeepers were wonderful, detail oriented and quick to fulfill special requests. Everyday my room was spotless even though all I wanted was a touch up. They cleaned and restocked completely daily. Breakfast was sufficient and fresh, the waffles were a plus. Air conditioner worked great. Shower head was strong and I always had hot water. It was just a complete and overall pleasant stay and I definately recommend staying here and will be returning myself. Paige and all her staff make this place wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: sanddunerider
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here repeatedly, the rooms are always clean and ready to go. The management staff will help you with anything you may need. they do have pet rooms available, very few motels in branson allow this any longer. The Motel is 10 minutes from Silver Dollar City. Being Located on the west side of town, we can get to almost any show we want to see in just a few minutes. Paige, the manager can assist you with any show tickets in town at a great discounted price. You should call them @ 417-336-2666, we will be back next month.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: travelmom124
Reviews.Content: First off I want to say how nice the front desk was. Now with that out of the way.... Home Stay is right next door to one of the shows. Every night the parking lot would fill up with the cars from ppl seeing the show. So if you leave for dinner and come back there is no where to park! This happened every night of our stay. We brought our dog with us, so we were put in a "pet room". I understand that the other rooms may be way nicer than the one we had. Ours needed a lot of TLC to say the least. It smelled of smoke, and I actually had to go out and buy some room deodorizer. Other than that it was okay. Probably won't stay again due to the parking lot situation every night, and condition of the room:(

Reviews.Title: “Decent place!”
Reviews.Author: Country_Traveler2011
Reviews.Content: Nice size bed and room. Not a big but decent breakfast. If you are looking for an economical room this is a good place.The evening lady @ the front desk was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great price, clean room, but....slow wifi, tepid "hot" water, futon-height bed says hmmm.”
Reviews.Author: asiapointriders
Reviews.Content: The check-in manager was friendly, and the room was spacious for the price. But living in it was disappointing. For starters, the wi-fi was realllly slow. Possibly because I was on an end unit, downstairs and too far from the central modem but it was late, I was tired, and didn't want to hassle with a move. The bed, supposedly a king, barely reached the level of my knee. It feels like sleeping on an airbed or futon - so watch out if you have bad knees. Despite 4 lamps in the room, it was too dark to read. These must all be 40 watt. I watched the old fashioned box tv for a couple of hours and went to sleep. Next morning, I went to make coffee in the little in-room sunbeam maker. No cups! I figured the hot coffee would melt those little plastic drinking cups so drank it out of the pot and of course that was awkward! But, had I known the shower had no setting beyone "slightly warm" I would have used that handy little coffeepot to boil hot water for a tub bath. Alas, didn't have time, and was already shivering naked in the shower when i thought of the idea. Other reviews of this motel are so positive, I am tempted to try it again and request a room closer to the modem (and the hot water tank). Location and cleanliness outweight the nusiances mentioned, so if you find yourself in need of a clean, simple room at a reasonable price, try HomeStay. But bring your own coffee cup. :)

Reviews.Title: “This place is great!”
Reviews.Author: Katie C
Reviews.Content: Homestay Inn is a great place to stay. We had such a great visit. They have clean lodging and friendly staff. Paige was great! I couldnt have asked for a better home away from home and will continue to stay at the Homestay Inn when I am in Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Found our Branson motel”
Reviews.Author: biscuitcreek
Reviews.Content: We have tried several moderately priced Branson motels that have been recommended to us and each time have been disappointed. We were not disappointed by the recommendation for HomeStay Inn in Branson. Paige was very warm and welcoming and even offered to help us unload and carry our luggage to our room. Was pleasantly surprised to find such a large room that had 2 beds, table and 2 chairs, a credenza, 2 luggage racks, a fridge, a microwave, and a coffeemaker. Room was extremely clean. There were plenty of towels and even a rubber bathmat for the tub/shower. Even though the motel is on Shepherd of the Hills Expressway and next door to the Pierce Arrow theater, we could not hear any noise from the outside in our room. The air conditioning and the heat worked well (weather was such that we needed both during the weekend). Breakfast was very good -- nice assortment of pastries, cereal, fresh fruit, and waffles. Only drawback for us was the TV -- we noticed the color and contrast was a bit off. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “We have stayed three times”
Reviews.Author: glitzey
Reviews.Content: Paige and her employees are very nice. We really like having a fridge and microwave that is a nice added bonus to their rooms. Rooms are plain, but clean. They do need better lighting as it is very dark in the rooms with having tan walls and dark carpet. The location is great you can miss alot of the 76 traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!!!”
Reviews.Author: david l
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough good about Paige and the crew here. An outstanding place for a lot less than most of the hotels in Branson. The pool was awesome, room spotless, and a great breakfast. Not right on the strip, but a great location easy to get in and out of, and only a few blocks from all the "action". We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “We will definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: MartinFamily5
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at a lot of hotels in Branson. Not one priced at this point has met what we experienced at HomeStay Inn. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The bathroom and vanity area were very clean as well, which doesn't happen often in other hotels I have stayed in! One feature we really liked was the entry. It was tiled instead of carpeted so when we walked in from the pool, we didn't soak the carpet. The TV package is one of the best we have come across in any hotel we have ever stayed in. Paige and her staff were very helpful. We enjoyed our stay and will certainly be back very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Good clean hotel. Can't beat it for the price!”
Reviews.Author: OUChamps29
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here over a long weekend after hearing great things about the place online. We found the room to be nice, clean, and comfy. We had a king bed room with a couch. Nothing fancy of course, but for the price you can't beat it. We enjoyed breakfast in the nice breakfast room/nook. The excellent and friendly staff were very helpful! Also, the in-room Wi-Fi was the best I've had at any hotel, regardless of price. Good place to stay if you want bang for your buck.

Reviews.Title: “Won't be back because.....”
Reviews.Author: Carol T
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by the mom's blog website on facebook so I thought why not try it. Upon arrival we got a list of shows that the hotel discounted tickets for so later we decided to change our plans for the evening and go see a show. When I went back to the lobby to purchase the tickets I was told that the ticket office was closed. I wasn't told when I checked in that it closed at a certain time. The room seemed clean but during our 2 night stay I killed 3 roaches. The pool was old but clean. The dining area was old and small but again, clean. The pastries were dried out but the waffles were great! In Branson there are a hundred hotels to choose from even at the price I paid for this one and I don't have to worry about roaches. I won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room!”
Reviews.Author: Realistic66614
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a third floor room on Friday August 12th. The room was obviously recently refurbished, new tub shower, toilet and flooring material. Very nice decor in lobby. Exterior of the building shows some age, but that didn't take away from our visit. Small room of lobby for continental breakfast. No restaurant, but room key is good for discount's at local restaurant, many within walking distance. We didn't make it to the pool, so I can not rate it. We saw lots of pets staying with other guest.

Reviews.Title: “Too many hotels in Branson to choose this one again.”
Reviews.Author: mharmonLouisville
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Homestay Inn 3 nights while in Branson. Days 1&2 there were minor problems, we were assigned room 322 but the key cards we were given would not open the door. The dest clerk tried but also could not get them to work. We were moved to room 320. Problem solved! Day 2. My wife found dirty towels behind the bathroom door left by the previous guest and the tub drain was so slow that you were standing in dirty water by the time you finished your shower. I reported both problems to the front desk and they were taken care of before we returned to our room. Day 3. Sometime during the night the refrigerator quit working and everything inside was warm. I called the front desk to report the problem and was told there was no one to fix it. Now we get to the major problem, I've never had this happen before. Sometime after we left our room for the day the cleaning person cleaned the room and when she left did not close the door completely and when we returned the door was unlocked. I reported it the next morning when we were leaving and was told they would talk to the staff. In a city where you have a hotel on every block you have to do better than this!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: peachpitsister
Reviews.Content: Quick check-in. Friendly staff. Great Wi-fi. Microwave and fridge were great to have. Clean room. I was glad they put the comforter in the dresser and double-sheeted the blanket (worn). Our room looked like it had been updated and/or well maintained. The exterior of the building is showing it's age and could use some TLC. Basic breakfast (raisin bran, cheerios, pastries, toast, oatmeal, waffle-maker, fresh fruit). Fruit was very good (bananas, apples, navel oranges, and peaches). I wish the coffee had been stronger. We enjoyed the Culligan water cooler for refilling our water bottles. Small outdoor pool. One of my daughters swam one evening and had the pool to herself while I sat by the pool with my feet in the water. Chairs and a couple of tables, no loungers. Walked down the street to Dreami-Cream for frozen custard (Andy's on the strip is the best). We didn't go to any of the shows; but, there's a theater next door and another across the street. Great location for Silver Dollar City. You will need a vehicle to get around town. Best part: The cost was an average of $48 per night (tax incl) with a 3rd night free promotion. That's for 5 in our family with a roll away. Before booking online, I called Paige and she made us a great offer. There's so many hotels offering low prices in town. For what we needed (lower hotel bill so we could spend more on activities and attractions), HomeStay met our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ShaunR1826
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at a rate of $51/night on July 22-23. This is not the Ritz, but for the price we thought it was excellent. Clean room that looks like it had been updated fairly recently with a fridge and microwave. The AC blows ICE cold. Pool was clean. In my opinion the west end of Sheperd of the Hills expressway is the best location in Branson, especially if going to Silver Dollar City is your primary reason for going. It allows easy access to all of the "main Strip" without having to drive down the entire length of the strip. There are several roads from Sheperd of the Hills that tie into the main strip that allow you to bypass most of the traffic. If you've ever been to Branson you know how bad the traffic on the strip is. The only way I would stay on the strip is if it was directly beside a road that leads to Sheperd of the Hills. The front desk staff were very helpful on answering any questions we had and check in and check out were quick. The only complaint I had (which wasn't enough to dock a star) was that on our second day there, when coming back to the room at 6:30 from Silver Dollar City, the cleaning lady was just getting to our room. She had already done everything except vacuum so we told her it was fine as the floor was ok. All in all a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: sanddunerider
Reviews.Content: Have been here before, rooms are always top notch and clean. The Staff here is great. The breakfast is always fresh. The room rates a below average costs. We cant say enough good things about this motel.. the manager name is Paige and she and her crew do anything to accomadate your needs. They even get my show tickets for me at a discounted rate. Great Place to stay!!!! Give them a call [...]

Reviews.Title: “Good stay, Great value!”
Reviews.Author: kvvbs
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights with our small children. The room was clean and quiet with good AC--nothing fancy, but we didn't spend much time there anyway. Kids enjoyed the (outdoor) pool. We were able to check in a little early and when 2 of our lamps didn't work, they replaced the bulbs right away. We also got SDC tickets at a good deal right from the front desk. Great service. Downside: my husband didn't think the beds were very comfy, and we had to walk up several stairs to get to our room each time. We got a "third night free" special, so ended up with a very good price! I can't complain.

Reviews.Title: “So-So”
Reviews.Author: drummercutie04
Reviews.Content: We booked online and did not get a very good deal. All hotels advertised a cheaper deal than online. The hotel staff was very friendly. The breakfast waffles were GREAT! The rooms left something to be desired. Even on ground floor its a long walk to the rooms. The lighting was poor, but the beds were double sheeted which was nice. One night we came back at 8 pm and housekeeping still hadn't been to our room, so after that we were sure to hang the sign out every day. The pool was nice, but always crowded with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Families!”
Reviews.Author: AHenson77
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three night stay at Eagle's Lodge and will definitely stay there again on our next trip. We decided to give it a try after reading several positive reviews on a Branson message board and were not disappointed. The rates at this hotel are VERY reasonable and I admit that when you see prices like this you can't but wonder what the quality of the room will be like. We live only a few hours away from Branson so we visit frequently and have stayed in many different hotels in the area. This place was much cleaner and had much nicer staff then some of the places we have stayed and paid at least double for. Not to mention that the rooms have a fridge AND microwave, which is a must when staying more than a couple of days in Branson. Eating out every meal will cost you a small fortune. The rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We asked for extra towels and someone was at our door within 5 minutes with them. We will definitely be staying there on all our future visits!

Reviews.Title: “Cheesehead57”
Reviews.Author: Cheesehead57
Reviews.Content: WE stayed at Eagles Lodge/Homestay Inn for 2 weeks. Paige the manager was the most gracious host we ever had. The rooms were clean and kept supplied with whatever we needed on a daily basis. We will stay there again when in Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: BeReady
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eagle's Lodge for three nights (April 20-23) at the recommendation of some friends. The hotel is conveniently located right across the street from Shoji Tabuchi's theater. It is within 10-15 minutes (depending on traffic) of most Branson attractions including Silver Dollar City. There are several restaurants (and an ice cream stand) within easy walking distance of the Hotel. And many give you a discount if you show them you're room key. The rooms are clean and include a coffee pot, microwave and refrigerator (the latter two are must when you have a family with young children). Their breakfast features cereal, oatmeal, donuts, coffee, juice and hot fresh waffles. The hotel has very reasonable rates including a stay two nights get the third night free. The management was very friendly and helpful. I heartily recommend this hotel to all travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Great place in a nice location for Branson travel”
Reviews.Author: Mhguy77
Reviews.Content: I was on a Branson trip going to Silver Dollar City and checked into the Eagles Lodge. Let me say I live 1.5 hours away so I have been to and often travel to Branson. Bottom line this is a convenient fairly priced clean hotel with very nice location. If you check the map this is located at the last light in Branson on the SDC side, off Shepard of the Hills expressway. My opinion the perfect location. IF you haven't been to Branson the traffic is terrible and in the mornings its a real bear getting to SDC. But the location right at the lights allows you to miss 99% of all the Branson traffic while keeping you right near all the attractions. I recommend it. Clean Room, Nice front desk person Accepts pets Fairly priced and most of all GREAT LOCATION

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: okiebluegrass
Reviews.Content: I had a very nice trip to the Eagles Lodge hotel in Branson over Young Christian's Weekend (April 1 -3, 2011) The rooms were very clean and the beds were comfortable. They had a fridge and microwave in each room. They have nice deep bathtubs a big guy like me can lay down in. The breakfast was very good. I will definitely be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Management- Great rates”
Reviews.Author: sanddunerider
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this motel several times last year and will consider doing so. They have great rates. The Manager (Paige) is great! She gets all my show trickets for me, Late check ins are no problem. the motel is pet friendly. Just a great place to stay. We suggest them to anybody we talk to.!

Reviews.Title: “Clean updated Room at a Great Price.”
Reviews.Author: Malget
Reviews.Content: We arived early on a friday and had an easy check in. Paige the manager told us about some great discounts we could recieve with our rook key card and let us know about breakfast. The next morning we had Waffles, cereal, toast, pastries, and fruit. Thanks for a good breakfast. This hotel is in a great location, located right across from Shoji Tabuchi and right next to Pierce Arrow Theater. If you are looking a good value and a nice hotel give them a try.

Reviews.Title: “Feel's like home”
Reviews.Author: pegiot
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel by walking by. The price was good, and we were pleased with the room they showed us. The receptionists were very pleasant and helpful. The room was very clean, and nice but not fancy. The breakfast included make-your-own waffles. The location is great - across the street from Shoji and Grandma's Restaurant. It is also close to Silver Dollar City and the Butterfly Garden. I just wish it had a pool.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: raymondsibley
Reviews.Content: Two couples with adjoining rooms, spent one enjoyable week in Branson. Clean rooms, pleasant staff, good housekeeping. Looking forward to staying there again next year, perfect location

Reviews.Title: “Great location and a clean room, at a terrific rate!”
Reviews.Author: GetReal2
Reviews.Content: The wife and I recently spent an extended weekend in Branson. It was our first visit to the Branson area, and were not familiar with the the area. After reading the reviews here on Trip Advisor, we decided to take a chance and booked our stay with a locally owned hotel operator, instead of one of the name brand large hotel chains. Eagle's Lodge was offering a stay two nights, the third night is free promotion. The staff, at check-in,was very friendly, helpful, and knowledgeable about the area. Make no mistake this is an older hotel. It appeared that the room, including the bathroom, had been recently renovated. The room was freshly painted, and the carpets appeared to be relatively new, and most importantly clean. The rooms were large, with plenty of room to move around, and came equipped with a microwave, refrigerator, and a coffee maker. The only draw back to the room was that the furniture was very dated, and I found the mattress to be very soft. The wife liked the soft mattress. The air condition was VERY cold, a feature that is very hard to find these days! There also was a very limited selection available with the free continental breakfast. There were hot waffles, some pastries, and two types of cereal, and fruit available on the breakfast bar. There was also orange juice, milk, and coffee to choose from. There are two shows within EASY walking distance from the hotel, and the Silver Dollar City theme park is only about ten minutes away. Overall, the wife and I enjoyed our stay at the Eagle's Lodge, and we will stay here again the next time we return to Branson. The value, cleanliness, and the location of this establishment is hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place To Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Kathisme
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eagles Lodge from October 5-9 in 2010 and I think they now have a loyal return customer. Here's my thoughts on different aspects of the hotel. Manager: Paige is the new manager here and she sold me on the hotel. Her attitude is amazing and she really seems to enjoy the job and the people she meets. Front Desk: Wonderfully nice people at all times. I never once encountered a single person who didn't go out of their way to be helpful. The area there was decorated nice and clean. Room: When we walked in, it smelled clean and looked clean. Nothing was out of place. Tv was decent sized, fridge/microwave/coffee maker was part of the cost and worked well, plenty of storage room for clothes & suitcases. Wifi worked great for me and the parking was free. Bathroom: It was clean, towels were plenty, lots of hot water, good water pressure, soap & shampoos waiting for us and some of the towels were folded into neat little shapes. Beds: Our beds were COMFORTABLE queens! We stayed at the Ramada before we got to Branson and the beds there didn't even compare. They were hard and these were softer and had a little more bounce. I guess if you like a hard bed, these would have been miserable though . lol. Breakfast: Standard fare of waffles, milk, cereal, pastries, fruit, oatmeal and coffee. The breakfast room was nice and clean. Parking: Well... this is probably one downside to the place. It's built on a hill and the parking lot is at quite a slope. You can unload your luggage near the front door to make it a little easier with that, but at some point you may have to walk up the hill or climb some stairs. To most people this wouldn't be a problem, but if it is, just ask the hotel if they could place you in a room that suits your needs best. They are so accommodating and helped us immensly. They have special area for handicapped parking also and it's not on a hill. Pet Friendly: We didn't bring our dog, but wished we would have! Turns out they welcome pets and I think I heard her say at no additional charge. Pool: They have a nice sized pool with lots of deck chairs. We weren't able to use it though since it was October. Pricing: The rates are $64 a night, but they had a special deal at the time we booked... third night free. Location: Pierce Arrow was right next door, Shoji, Hamner Barber and Barbara Fairchild/Bob Nelson were across the street. We were able to walk to The Imax complex within 5 minutes (and we walk slow). Everything else was just a short drive away as they're located on Shepard of the Hills Expressway (red route). What we didn't like: The room didn't seem bright enough...with light. Would we stay again... most definitely!

Reviews.Title: “Great Accommodations!”
Reviews.Author: fishing2
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this motel for three nights. It had everything we wanted and needed in a motel. The manager, Page was cheerful and great to work with. Eagle's Lodge was clean and the bonus was the refrigerator and microwave. For the reasonable price it was a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, excellent price, great experience.”
Reviews.Author: mwagner32210
Reviews.Content: We had stayed in this hotel once before and had a wonderful experience there, so when we decided to return to Branson we called there first for reservations. The rooms are very nice, nothing fancy, but everything we needed. The manager and her staff are wonderful people who try to do everything they can to make your stay there enjoyable. I would highly recommend Eagles Lodge, and I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: kerusso
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to everything and offered very reasonable rates during our stay. The staff is friendly and the rooms are clean and comfortable. The continental breakfast is pretty basic. The parking is not the greatest due to the fairly steep hill you have to park on but it is the Ozarks and hills are to be expected.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: princess922gramma
Reviews.Content: I have stayed for many years at the Eagles Lodge usually a few times a month during the season may thru dec. . The rooms have been remoldeled and they look great, they have a nice warm welcoming feeling. And as always the staff was very knowlegeable about how to get to everywhere. They also welcome pets and my dog Emma loves it there!

Reviews.Title: “disgusting”
Reviews.Author: zbkurtz
Reviews.Content: We pulled back our bed and there were actual pieces of dirt on the sheets. The shampoo bottle had been opened from the previous guests and not replaced. The next morning we told the manager about the sheets and shampoo. He said he would "fix us up". When we returned that night very late I pulled back the sheets to see some left over particles of dirt from the night before meaning the maid still did not change the sheets, nor did she replace the bottle of shampoo. There was also a dirty Kleenex between the two beds on the floor and my husband and I knew it wasn't ours because we had not used one. My husband called the manager and asked to switch rooms. The exact response was "the best I can do for you is bring you a new set of sheets, but you will have to put them on yourself because I am the only person here". On further investigation we found some silica beads in my daughters bed. We were out of there! My husband went to the front office to let them know we were very unhappy and that we were checking out and that we want a full refund. They said "no, we will not give you a refund and we are still going to charge you for tonight too". I had a dispute claim filed with my credit card company before we even left the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “accomidating and trustworthy staff”
Reviews.Author: 3ladybugs
Reviews.Content: My mother, sister and I recently visited Branson for "Black Friday" sales. The hotel had great prices for us. The room was very clean, my 11 month old neice was allowed to crawl all around without hesitation. The breakfast was nice, fresh waffles. The staff was very accomidating, allowing us a later check out time without extra charge. We left all of our shopping bags in our room and not one item was touched...very trustworthy staff. I have stayed here several time and will return here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Tweentrails
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at at least six different hotels in Branson. All have been clean and satisfactory. However, it's hard to beat the price at the Eagles Inn. The one quirk is that the hotel is built on a slope, so that you can't predict which rooms are "ground level." You should ask in advance if that's a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: trips-for-fun
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eagles Inn for 5 nights. The price was an incredible 36.95 plus tax for the 3 of us. We went with another family and the staff got us rooms beside of each other. The room was very clean. The bathroom fixtures looked to be brand new. We had 2 beds, TV, coffee maker, hairdryer. The guys loved the outside entrance to the room. They sat outside each night and smoked their cigars while we got the kids settled. The breakfast was great. The hot waffles were an added touch. They also had the usual muffins, donuts, fruit, cereal etc. The location was WONDERFUL. The hotel is very close to the intersection of HWY 76 and Shepherd Hills Parkway. We were able to get to the attractions without having to deal with the traffic on HWY 76. Silver Dollar City, Celebration City were extremely easy to get to. Would recommend this hotel to anyone. You will really love the low price charged to your card at the end of trip!!!!

HotelInfo.Name: HomeStay Inn Branson
HotelInfo.Address: 3221 Shepherd of the Hills Expressway, Branson, MO 65616 (Formerly Eagle's Lodge)
